noun.description: A thin, narrow piece of wood, plastic, or metal, especially one of a series which overlap or fit into each other, as in a fence or a Venetian blind.
examples: sunlight filtered dustily through the slats of the door

origin: Late Middle English (in the sense roofing slate): shortening of Old French esclat splinter, from esclater to split. The current sense dates from the mid 18th century.
